mashFermentables.name: Pilsner
mashFermentables.notes: BEST Pilsner Malt gives beer a fresh and rounded taste. It is used for all types of beers based on basically barley malt. It forms an excellent “light” and enzyme-rich foundation for almost all beer styles. Malt characteristics: low protein levels, high extract content, light colour and high enzymatic activity.

BEST Pale Ale deepens the light “golden” color of top-fermented beers, creating a pleasant flavor. It forms an excellent enzyme-rich foundation for intensive colored beer styles. It is an excellent base malt for brewing many different styles of British Pale Ale as well as for brewing Kölsch beer.
mashFermentables.name: Pale Ale Malt

mashFermentables.usedIn: Lager and ales up to 20% of grist.
mashFermentables.name: Munich Malt
mashFermentables.notes: Munich Malt has its origins in Germany where traditional beers gained their rich malty character from the addition of specialist malts with enhanced colour and flavour. These products are made on a conventional malt kiln using processes that promote higher levels of soluble protein and simple sugars which interact when heat is applied to produce a product rich in melanoidins and other colour and flavour compounds. The malty flavours associated with Munich Malt contrast with the caramel-like flavours associated with crystal malts and the golden to reddish hues to the colour is popular in some beer styles.

source.name: 02 NL Spa Reine Flat Mineral Water (www.ah.nl)

hops.notes:
The essential oil profile displays characteristics of “fresh crushed gooseberries” a descriptor often used for the grape variety Sauvignon Blanc, giving rise to this variety’s name. Nelson Sauvin has the unique ability to impart a distinctive cool climate white wine “fruitiness”. The complexity of the oils profile has seen selectors stretched looking for descriptors to document this unique new world variety.
Very much at home in the new-world styles such as American Pale Ale and IPA’s. This hop is considered by some as being extreme and it certainly makes it presence felt in speciality craft and seasonal beers
This is a must use hop!
hops.name: Nelson Sauvin (T90)
Nectaron (HORT4337) (T90)
hops.notes:
Evoking the unmistakable aromas of the tropics, Nectaron captures the sense and tantalises the tastebuds with crafter notes of pineapple, passionfruit, peach and grapefruit. Already prove to add abundant character to styles such as strong pale ales and IPAs, this hop is a hop that can sing by itself or add an undeniable ‘wow’ to any brew.
Citrus, Pineapple, Passionfruit, Grapefruit, Stonefruit

hops.name: Riwaka
hops.usedIn: IPA's, American Pale Ales and Imperial Pilsners

yeasts.name: Hophead Ale
yeasts.description: M66 Hophead Ale Yeast is a yeast and enzyme blend that has been designed to promote a hop forward, fruity profile – perfect for contemporary IPAs from New England to West Coast styles. Dry hop character will be enhanced along with aroma from any fruit additions made during fermentation. The moderate, well balanced ester profile from this yeast will complement New World hop character very well whilst also bringing out some malt character. This yeast ferments clean and relatively neutral with a moderate, well-balanced ester profile adding subtle complexity. Beers fermented with this yeast will finishing moderately dry but retaining a good level of mouthfeel to prevent them being too thin. With good alcohol tolerance up to 10% ABV, this yeast works particularly well in stronger IPA styles. Higher ABV beers will retain a good level of body without being too heavy. Sprinkle contents directly onto a maximum of 23 L(6 US Gal) of wort. Suitable to ferment 18-22°C (64-72°F). Store below 10 °C (50 °F)
